title: NFL Rivals
subtitle: A fast-paced, arcade-style game featuring licensed NFL teams and players.
description: NFL Rivals was my first professional game project. I joined Mythical Games during pre-production and stayed with the title for over two years post-launch.

I worked closely with UX designers and UI artists, translating Figma wireframes into polished features across Inventory, Marketplace, Trading, Crafting, Training, Tutorials, Quests, Achievements, and Prime Integration.

The Inventory was a standout feature. It started as a single screen but became central to the game when I refactored it into reusable modules. The resulting framework was shared with two other studios.

With thousands of collectable items, performance mattered. I implemented pooling and load reduction to keep it at 30fps on low-end devices, and built a Linked List Layout Rebuilder to handle nested dropdown filtering and minimise expensive layout recalculations.
I authored flow through most of the games features using Playmaker FSMs.
On the backend, I built and extended features, debug tools, and admin tools with Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis, and Handlebars.
I also built tween-based animations, extended the gameplay HUD, and iterated on editor tooling for marketing asset capture.
